channel.title: Usb iso boot loop
channel.description:
hi,
tried to boot from USB to install kicksecure as host system .
when i select the first boot option from grub
errors shown and nothing happen further .
some of these errors shown
wrong fs type dracut-initqueue dracut fatal failed to find a root filesystem system halted
is there any chance to get it working or choose another option
if there is no fix , i can understand kicksecure is not supported nor compatible with my hardware unlike debian

item.description:
I am not aware LVM helps with Plausible Deniability / Unallocated space.

I dont read any content based on chatgpt .
I hate AI , its not helpful nor was able to find forgotten quote i looked for until searched deep manually without AI

As newcomer i will discuss lvm afterward related to PDE
maybe in case of hiding encryption

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
suse211213:

[FAILED] : failed to mount sysroot.mount -/sysroot.

Kicksecure – 12 Oct 24

Utilize Search Engines, Documentation and AI

Avoid basic questions. Effective use of search engines and AI (Artificial Intelligence). Utilizing extensive Kicksecure documentation.

ISO error message during boot: mount: /sysroot: special device LiveOS_rootfs does not exist Development
Does not have any known bad effects but is an optical issue that many users will report, therefore needs to be fixed. Mar 12 12:51:24 localhost systemd[1]: run-initramfs-squashfs.mount: Deactivated successfully. Mar 12 12:51:24 localhost systemd[1]: Mounting sysroot.mount - /sysroot... Mar 12 12:51:24 localhost mount[545]: mount: /sysroot: special device LiveOS_rootfs does not exist. Mar 12 12:51:24 localhost mount[545]: dmesg(1) may have more information after failed mount system call. …
suse211213:

1- it would be nice if possible to install encrypted lvm ?

Calamares installer supports encryption.

Do you really need LVM necessarily? Use case?

Read full topic

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: nurmagoz
item.description:
suse211213:

[FAILED] : failed to mount sysroot.mount -/sysroot.
The error appear also on virtual box .

I don’t know how how serious the error is and what it means

Known issue, its ok to proceed.

suse211213:

1- it would be nice if possible to install encrypted lvm ?

LVM is unsupported at the moment due to calamares lacks it. Setting it up as post-installation is risky for data loss.

suse211213:

2- either gnome flash tool or recent version caused boot loop error. i dont know

Provide more details, the sentence looks ambiguous to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: suse211213
item.description:
Great news !

I have tried to convert debian to kicksecure, but it seems it wont transform Debian in genuine kicksecure iso
synaptic packet manager still exist there
design xfce look and colors don’t match

downloaded today kicksecure iso , this time used etcher for Linux . and see
everything works fine, except one error during boot time
[FAILED] : failed to mount sysroot.mount -/sysroot.
The error appeared also on virtual box .

I don’t know how serious the error is and what it means

But after the error windows boots fine .

Kicksecure on its own is awesome, lightweight and fast.

1- it would be nice if possible to install encrypted lvm ?
2- either gnome flash tool or recent version caused boot loop error. i dont know

Read full topic

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: suse211213
item.description:
That looks very hard for normal user
doesn’t matter but still very informative.

either dist-morph or best at VM the way to go.

Thanks anyway

While kicksecure is great, the only concern is compared to a standard, rolling release distro due to debian philosophy packages are outdated hence bad for keeping close to upstream and bad for security

Correct me if i am wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
suse211213:

Never seen a linux distro that wont boot due to boot issue, this is related to kicksecure on its own

Could be.

To debug further, would require debugging dracut, which isn’t easy.

That means enabling verbose kernel messages, enabling debug mode in dracut.

There is How to debug Dracut problems - Fedora Project Wiki but these instructions might be too difficult for users to follow.

  • Remove rhgb and quiet from the kernel command line

We’re not using rhgb but quiet.

“remove from kernel command line” also is quite of an assumption that users know how to do that. Even just removing quiet from kernel command line might help to show what is happening. Perhaps it is a hardware issue but that is not clear yet. Even it it is, it might be fixable with other kernel parameters.

Kernel Boot Parameter Change documents how to change kernel command line.

Next issue is, even after enabling the debug log, it needs to be transferred to USB so it can be copied into the forums for analysis.

Also not trivial and most users don’t have this kind of frustration tolerance so these issues remain unfixed until someone shows up who does.

Read full topic

correct as per docs

item.title: Usb iso boot loop
item.dc:creator: suse211213
item.description:
Patrick Schleizer:

What did you do?

Written the [Kicksecure Live ISO and Installer/wiki/ISO) to USB, booted it. That worked, I suppose?

yest through gnome-disk-utility

i can boot from USB

Then you started the calamares installer and installed to internal disk?

No

the GRUB Boot Loader appears , but when i select kicksecure on top of grub blue screen then errors follows and hangs on black screen texts

Doesn’t seem like a hardware issue. Boot issue. But equally difficult to fix.

Never seen a linux distro that wont boot due to boot issue, this is related to kicksecure on its own IMO

Read full topic

item.description:
Just morph Debian into Kicksecure. I installed Kicksecure host, but it seems to me that it needs to be improved - there are many minor bugs that are published on this forum. I installed Debian and then Kicksecure - it works great. I am very satisfied
